column4: hey, i'm trying to make a bootable usb on windows using the latest unetbootin... I've formatted my drive to fat32, the windows standard. It's not booting... What is windows doing wrong?
the pendrivelinux web site has alterantives to unetbootin that may work for you
the purpose of this is to display to a nonprofit how linux can be made to look like windows
yeah, but is it a format issue or do i just need a *nix box to do it properly? i assume the partition doesn't have the boot flag for some reason
i don't have admin priviledges on this machine
you can image the iso file straight to the flash if you wanted to.
